required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: To Explore the Effect of GH on Outcomes of IVF and Telomerase Activity of Granulosa Cells in Women With POR
clinical_study.official_title: To Explore the Effect of Growth Hormone on Outcomes of in Vitro Fertilisation and Telomerase Activity of Granulosa Cells in Women With Poor Ovarian Response

brief_summary.textblock: It is still a big difficult clinical problem for patients with poor ovarian reserve undergoing in vitro fertilization. The decrease in both quality and quantity of egg are the main cause for poor clinical prognosis. Growth hormone (GH) is currently one of the main adjuvant for improving pregnancy outcomes in patients with POR, and the investigators' previous retrospective study suggested GH was effective in live birth rate in subgroup of patients with POR older than 35 years old. To further figure out the mechanism of GH effectiveness in POR patients and the effect on clinical outcomes in POR patients, the investigators designed this prospective observational cohort study.

primary_outcome.description: Clinical pregnancy means pregnancy sac is seen intrauterine under ultrasound 7 weeks after embryo transferred.

secondary_outcome.description: Live birth rate(%): number of live birth/ transferred cycle.
number of oocytes retrieved on day of OPU

other_outcome.description: detection of telomerase activity of granulosa cells in wasted follicular fluid

clinical_study.condition: Poor Ovarian Reserve Based on POSEIDON

arm_group.description: Participants diagnosed POR according to POSEIDON criteria with low ovarian reserve undergo IVF in our center with long protocol or antagonist protocol and is adjuvant with GH 2IU/d from previous menstrual period for about six weeks.
Participants diagnosed POR according to POSEIDON criteria with low reserve undergo IVF in our center with long protocol or antagonist protocol without GH adjuvant.
Participants with normal ovarian reserve undergo IVF in our center with long protocol or antagonist protocol without GH adjuvant.

intervention.description: growth hormone was adjuvanted 2IU/d from previous menstrual period for about six weeks.

study_pop.textblock: The study population includes patients diagnosed as POR based on POSEIDON criteria and with low ovairan reserve, as well as patients with normal ovairan reserve seeking for ART help due to pelvic tubal factors.

results_reference.citation: Poseidon Group (Patient-Oriented Strategies Encompassing IndividualizeD Oocyte Number), Alviggi C, Andersen CY, Buehler K, Conforti A, De Placido G, Esteves SC, Fischer R, Galliano D, Polyzos NP, Sunkara SK, Ubaldi FM, Humaidan P. A new more detailed stratification of low responders to ovarian stimulation: from a poor ovarian response to a low prognosis concept. Fertil Steril. 2016 Jun;105(6):1452-3. doi: 10.1016/j.fertnstert.2016.02.005. Epub 2016 Feb 26.
